content:
It's Kaizen 18! Can you believe it? We discuss the recent Fly.io outage, some little features we've added since our last Kaizen, our new video-first production, and of course, catch up on all things Pipely! Oh, and Gerhard surprises us (once again). BAM! :link: https://changelog.am/82

Talking about the chapter links here in Zulip and the discussion about the videos on YouTube, I'm wondering what it takes to make links go to the same place in a YouTube video. Then if I'm listening to something and you're describing something you're seeing it would be cool to click to the specific section where you're showing something.

To answer @Jerod Santo's question about writing the Pipely docs on running it locally, I did write a lot of it while I was discovering and experimenting with making it work. I typically keep my notes of commands and references in a Markdown file as I go along, and the docs are the gradual process of refining those notes into something that could be useful to follow and repeat by other people (or my future self). I find it helps me capture the details of how I got somewhere, be able to easily set it aside and let go of it for any amount of time, then pick it back up at some point int he future to resume the adventures.

Some of my early rough notes (June 2024) helped in providing references to aid in discussions with @James A Rosen and @Gerhard via chat messages before the Let's Build a CDN - Part 2 video.
Loved the YouTube video on this episode to follow along with all the screen sharing in this episode!

Another great kaizen episode guys! Keep them coming! :clap::clap::clap:

Also, how am I just learning about Make it Work? I definitely have to check out these episodes now.

@Matt Johnson love it, thanks so much for helping build this! Re: chapter links to YT... Right now the audio and video are different lengths so the chapters don't line up exactly. We export the video chapters to create the YT timestamps, but we don't store them as official chapters in our database yet. To achieve this, we'd need to do that first. Not off the table, by any means.

Chris Duzan said:

how am I just learning about Make it Work?

It's pretty new! Definitely Like and Subscribe
This was one of my favorite moments: https://youtube.com/shorts/MjDLyQieYRo
